In appveyor I expericenced this issue with my System.Runtime.InteropServices.GitInformation package (I plan to donate or give the package away to the .net foundation sometime anyway for .net standard or .net core usage) The package is for embedding the git repository information including if it was a "clean" or "dirty" tree in the assembly for the end user could obtain and decide if they want to test any local (possibly with unstable changes) if they so desired. Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "DeleteAccountService should delete the user and then recreate it" (#7059) at NuGet/
Events.RelatedBody:
https://github.com/nuget/engineering/issues/2358

This guarantees that the deleted user is completely purged from the DB while not requiring any schema changes.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed pull request "DeleteAccountService should delete the row in the Users table" (#7055) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Part of https://github.com/NuGet/Engineering/issues/2358

Currently, when the `DeleteAccountService` deletes a user, it keeps the user's row in the `Users` table but scrubs of the data associated with that user. This has proven to be error-prone, because if DB relationships are not properly cleaned up, the `DeleteAccountService` does not fail, and these relationships still silently exist and may cause issues.

With this change, when a user is deleted, its row in the `Users` table is deleted and the username is persisted in the `AccountDelete`s table instead. When creating a new user or organization, this table is checked for username conflicts as well. Similarly to before, for unconfirmed accounts, we will not create a row in the `AccountDelete` table so that the username is not reserved.

I believe this is a positive change because
- if there is a bug with the `DeleteAccountService`, instead of silently failing and not cleaning up the deleted user data, it now will fail so that we will know we need to fix a problem
- the code is less complex, as there is no longer a `User.IsDeleted` field that we need to check everywhere or an `includeDeleted` parameter on `IUserService.FindByUsername` and `IUserService.FindByKey`--the only places that need to be aware of deleted account usernames are the register and add organization flows

I will follow this PR with some additional PRs that fix issues in the `DeleteAccountService`.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Nuget pack doesn't support blank <version> in .nuspec even though version is passed on the command line" (#7987) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem
When running `nuget pack` with a .nuspec file that contains an empty <version> and passing -Version on the command line, nuget will fail with the error:

> An error occured while trying to parse the value '' of property 'version' in the manifest file.
>   Value cannot be null or an empty string.
>   Parameter name: value

However, you put in a bogus version identifier in the nuspec file, the same command will run happily, with the version number passed on the command line.

NuGet product used:  NuGet.exe

NuGet version (x.x.x.xxx): 4.9.3.5777

OS version (i.e. win10 v1607 (14393.321)): Win 10 1903

## Detailed repro steps

1. Create a valid .nuspec file, but with an empty `version`, i.e. `<version></version>

2. Run `nuget.exe pack the.nuspec -Version 1.2.3.4 `

3. See error.

4. Replace `version` in .nuspec file with `<version>0.0.0.0</version>`

5. Run same command as above

6. See success.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Nuget pack does not ignore .vs folder" (#7986) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

NuGet product used (NuGet.exe | VS UI | Package Manager Console | dotnet.exe):

nuget.exe

NuGet version (x.x.x.xxx):

5.0.0.5923

OS version (i.e. win10 v1607 (14393.321)):

win10 10.0.17134

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

1. Created a new project, ala `dotnet new grpc`

2. Opened in visual studio - so it creates .vs folders

3. put together a nuspec file with no <files> element, just metadata

4. ran `nuget pack`

5. I get conflicting warning and error messages regarding folders that start with '.'

```Console
WARNING: NU5119: File 'C:\Users\Geocoder\Source\Repos\gRPC Template\.nuspec' was not added to the package. Files and folders starting with '.' or ending with '.nupkg' are excluded by default. To include this file, use -NoDefaultExcludes from the commandline
The process cannot access the file 'C:\Users\Geocoder\Source\Repos\gRPC Template\content\gRPCpi\.vs\gRPCpi\v16\Server\sqlite3\db.lock' because it is being used by another process.
```
...

## Other suggested things

The strange thing is, nothing seemed to have  that file open.  I had closed the solution in VS prior to running `nuget pack` and I was able to delete the .vs folder without issue right after it complained about the file.  Regardless, it should be ignoring that folder anyway, no?

### Verbose Logs

```
   at System.IO.__Error.WinIOError(Int32 errorCode, String maybeFullPath)
   at System.IO.FileStream.Init(String path, FileMode mode, FileAccess access, Int32 rights, Boolean useRights, FileShare share, Int32 bufferSize, FileOptions options, SECURITY_ATTRIBUTES secAttrs, String msgPath, Boolean bFromProxy, Boolean useLongPath, Boolean checkHost)
   at System.IO.FileStream..ctor(String path, FileMode mode, FileAccess access, FileShare share)
   at NuGet.Packaging.PhysicalPackageFile.GetStream()
   at NuGet.Packaging.PackageBuilder.WriteFiles(ZipArchive package, HashSet`1 filesWithoutExtensions)
   at NuGet.Packaging.PackageBuilder.Save(Stream stream)
   at NuGet.Commands.PackCommandRunner.BuildPackage(PackageBuilder builder, String outputPath)
   at NuGet.Commands.PackCommandRunner.BuildFromNuspec(String path)
   at NuGet.Commands.PackCommandRunner.BuildPackage()
   at NuGet.CommandLine.PackCommand.ExecuteCommand()
   at NuGet.CommandLine.Command.ExecuteCommandAsync()
   at NuGet.CommandLine.Command.Execute()
   at NuGet.CommandLine.Program.MainCore(String workingDirectory, String[] args)
```

### Sample Project

Very helpful if you can zip a project and paste into this issue!

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Misleading message "NU3028: The certificate is revoked."" (#7979) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Using `nuget.exe sign -Timestamper http://tsa.starfieldtech.com` from the command line:

```
Timestamping package(s) with:               
http://tsa.starfieldtech.com                
NU3028: The certificate is revoked.         
NU3028: Certificate chain validation failed.
```

It would seem like the next step would be to go to our certificate issuer who runs that timestamp server and as them why our tools are saying that their timestamp certificate is revoked, but that just sounded too strange to me.

So I investigated by signing a DLL with `signtool /t http://tsa.starfieldtech.com`. Referring to your [source code](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/face61a5b14066a36fe97b287e61eaae4078279e/src/NuGet.Core/NuGet.Packaging/Signing/Utility/CertificateChainUtility.cs#L58-L104), I used PowerShell to print out the problems with the timestamp cert:

```ps1
# File signed using http://tsa.starfieldtech.com
$signedFile = 'Test.dll'

$chain = [System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Chain]::new()

if ($chain.Build((Get-AuthenticodeSignature $signedFile).TimeStamperCertificate)) {
    "Timestamp certificate is valid."
} else {
    "Timestamp certificate is invalid."

    foreach ($status in $chain.ChainStatus) {
        ' - ' + $status.Status
    }
}
```

The result:

```markdown
Timestamp certificate is invalid.
 - PartialChain
 - RevocationStatusUnknown
 - OfflineRevocation
```

This area is new to me, so I looked up the [.NET docs for each flag](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/system.security.cryptography.x509certificates.x509chainstatusflags#fields):

| Enum value | Description |
| - | - |
| `PartialChain` | Specifies that the X509 chain could not be built up to the root certificate. |
| `RevocationStatusUnknown` | Specifies that it is not possible to determine whether the certificate has been revoked. This can be due to the certificate revocation list (CRL) being offline or unavailable. |
| `OfflineRevocation` | Specifies that the online certificate revocation list (CRL) the X509 chain relies on is currently offline. |

It sounds like a better message would be **NU3028: The certificate's revocation status is unknown.** Or, **NU3028: The X509 chain could not be built up to the root certificate.** Whichever one is the root cause, which I haven't figured out yet. But not, "The certificate is revoked."

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "nuget list & add commands are being deprecated in 5.0" (#34) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
Tracking Issue(s):
* Deprecate ambiguous nuget.exe commands in 5.0 [#7753](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/7753)
  * Deprecate nuget.exe add command [#7923](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/7923)
  * Rename nuget.exe list to nuget.exe search [#7912](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/7912)

The following commands are being deprecated because these are cause of confusion due to their nomenclature and/or other related commands that already exist:
* [`nuget list`](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/tools/cli-ref-list): Currently displays a list of packages from a given source
  * This will be replaced by an equivalent command **`nuget search`** which will be later enhanced with more capabilities as we make progress with or [search improvements](nvmd got it: https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/6371​​​​​​​).
* [`nuget add`](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/tools/cli-ref-add): Currently adds a specified package to a non-HTTP package source (a folder or UNC path) in a hierarchical layout, wherein folders are created for the package ID and version number. 
  * This will be replaced by overloading **`nuget push`** command.

> These commands will be deprecated i.e. there will be a warning on usage of these commands in 5.0 so that in future releases these commands can be discontinued.
